page.title: 15WILDLIFE
page.content: {BIRDS The commonest seabird in Durness is the Fulmar.On the east side of Faraid Head there are large numbers of Auks, Puffins and Gannets.As well as the common garden birds there can be seen various ducks such as eider,waders and birds of prey,the buzzard being the most common. {FLOWERS and TREES} There are many rare flowers in Durness noteably Primula Scotica.This rare plant grows only in the North of Scotland and is a protected species. Many alpine plants grow here too some of which normally occur only on mountain tops. As well as a wide variety of bog and heathland plants there are a few types orchids. There are very few trees,silver birch and rowan are native and, in sheltered places,sycamore,elm,ash and pine.
